name: df-met
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4
body: |- wceq(cmet, cmpt(s0, universe, crab(s1, co(cr, cmap, cxp(cv(s0), cv(s0))), wral(s2, cv(s0), wral(s3, cv(s0), wa(wb(wceq(co(cv(s2), cv(s1), cv(s3)), nat0), wceq(cv(s2), cv(s3))), wral(s4, cv(s0), wbr(co(cv(s2), cv(s1), cv(s3)), cle, co(co(cv(s4), cv(s1), cv(s2)), caddc, co(cv(s4), cv(s1), cv(s3)))))))))))
comment: Define the (proper) class of all metrics. (A metric space is the metric's base set paired with the metric; see ~ df-ms . However, we will often also call the metric itself a "metric space".) Equivalent to Definition 14-1.1 of [Gleason] p. 223. The 4 properties in Gleason's definition are shown by ~ met0 , ~ metgt0 , ~ metsym , and ~ mettri . (Contributed by NM, 25-Aug-2006.)
